blog.models module¶

class blog.models.Post(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Model for user-created posts.

Attributes¶

titleCharField

The title of the post.

contentTextField

The content of the post.

authorForeignKey

The user who created the post.

created_atDateTimeField

The date and time when the post was created.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

author¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
reviews¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

title¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

class blog.models.Review(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Model

Model for reviews on posts.

Attributes¶

postForeignKey

The post being reviewed.

userForeignKey

The user who wrote the review.

contentTextField

The content of the review.

ratingIntegerField

The rating given by the user.

created_atDateTimeField

The date and time when the review was created.

user_id¶

blog.views module¶

blog.views.add_post(request)¶

Handle the submission of a new blog post.

This view requires the user to be logged in. It handles both the display of the post form and the processing of the form submission.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

If the request method is POST and the form is valid, it redirects to the post list page. Otherwise, it renders the post form page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

blog.views.add_review(request, pk)¶

Handle the submission of a review for a specific blog post.

This view requires the user to be logged in. It handles both the display of the review form and the processing of the form submission.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • pk (int) – The ID of the blog post to which the review is being added.

Returns:

If the request method is POST and the form is valid, it redirects to the post detail page. Otherwise, it renders the review form page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

blog.views.blog_list(request)¶

Display a list of all blog posts.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

The rendered blog post list page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

blog.views.home(request)¶

Render the home page.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

The rendered home page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

blog.views.index(request)¶

Display the index page with a list of all blog posts.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

The rendered index page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

blog.views.login_view(request)¶

Handle user login.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

If the request method is POST and the form is valid, it redirects to the blog list page. Otherwise, it renders the login form page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

blog.views.post_detail(request, pk)¶

Display the details of a specific blog post.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • pk (int) – The ID of the blog post to display.

Returns:

The rendered blog post detail page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

blog.views.signup(request)¶

Handle user signup.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

If the request method is POST and the form is valid, it redirects to the login page. Otherwise, it renders the signup form page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

blog.views.user_dashboard(request)¶

Display the user’s dashboard with their posts and reviews.

This view requires the user to be logged in.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

The rendered user dashboard page.

Return type:

HttpResponse
